content.description: Start sitting on the right side of the bulge with an undercling and footholds in the grass. Climb up and left under the bulge and mantel up on the left side to finish.
content.location: In the middle of the smallest boulder in the Pasture.

content.description: Pick your choice of micro-edges/pinches to delicately move up the slab. Good technical slab practice.
content.location: Middle of the back (shorter) side of The Cow boulder, blank slab left of the obvious features for Cud Crack.

content.description: Climb the slab just to the right of the arete of BSE. Great introduction to slab climbing, the edges are slick on this one.
content.location: The first boulder of the area, to the right of the right arete when you are facing uphill.

content.description: Make a *big* jump to the obvious sloper in the middle of the face (it's actually pretty good), then finish on crimps in seams up and to the right. It's not over once you make the jump; the feet for the traverse up to the crimps are terrible/non-existent.
content.location: Right in the middle of The Cow boulder

content.description: Start on a juggy undercling, then make a few powerful moves to crawl up and along the arête for an easy top out.
content.location: Eastern side of the Cow boulder, likely the first problem you'll see as you walk into the Pasture.

content.description: Start as for Slaughterhosue, but climb straight up. Great way to crush your ego if you think you're killing it after Andy's Arete. A must climb for the pasture.
content.location: Middle of the smallest boulder in the Pasture.

content.description: Climb incut crimps in the right-leaning, less than vertical seam. Quite short, but not trivial.
content.location: On the uphill side of the cow boulder just around the corner from Feche la Vache

content.description: Start the same as cattle guard Dyno but angle up and right on the tiny crimps. Stand  on them and go for the obvious big sidepull! Seems theoretically possible.
content.location: About 5 feet right of cattleguard arete.

content.description: Start on the obvious crimper Gaston's and Dyno all the way to the good crimp! Seriously!? Was given a 9 in the book but I don't really take book grades seriously.
content.location: Just right of cattle guard Arete.

content.description: Stand start on the rounded arete, using some small crimpers. Heel hook and reach up to the sloping crimper, match then campus up to the top.
content.location: Obvious rounded arete at the Pasture, to the left of Andy's Arete.

content.description: Hop, skip or jump to the good rounded ledge at the eight foot level, trusting slippery footholds as you finish up and left.
content.location: To the right of Feche La Veche.

content.description: Start on the left of the western arête. Follow it up, moving further left as you climb to top out over two crimps. Tip: remember the foot under the flake, it makes all the difference for the last few moves and is hidden once you're in a position where you need it.
content.protection: One or two pads, stacked. The last move is by far the hardest for short-to-average sized folks.
content.location: On the far side of the Cow boulder (the first boulder you pass as you walk into the pasture).

content.description: A sit start power line for sure! Without giving too much away, try to control your swing while powering up to the flat ledge to mantle out.
content.location:
When you approach The Pasture, a rather large boulder with Andy's Arete will present itself. Walk approacher's left around that rock beyond Cattleguard Arete. Once you are on the flat slab, Barn Door starts on the furthest left side.

The start is obvious and the lading area is excellent.

content.description: A rather fun traverse-y, smear-y problem with an excellent landing area. Pay attention to your feet :)
content.location:
When approaching The Pasture, this is the first massive boulder you find and the first traverse line that catches your eye.

The start is at the beginning of the long lip and the finish is at the end of it.
